title: Tracking Issue for `Duration::try_from_secs_{f32, f64}`

labels.name: T-libs-api
labels.description: Relevant to the library API team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: C-tracking-issue
labels.description: Category: A tracking issue for an RFC or an unstable feature.

body:
Feature gate: `#![feature(duration_checked_float)]`

This is a tracking issue for checked methods to construct a duration from a floating-point value of seconds without panicking.

### Public API

```rust
// core::time

impl Duration {
    pub const fn try_from_secs_f32(secs: f32) -> Result<Duration, FromFloatSecsError>;
    pub const fn try_from_secs_f64(secs: f64) -> Result<Duration, FromFloatSecsError>;
}

#[derive(Debug, Clone, PartialEq, Eq)]
pub struct FromFloatSecsError { ... }

impl core::fmt::Display for FromFloatSecsError { ... }
```

```rust
// std::error

impl std::error::Error for FromFloatSecsError { ... }
```

### Steps / History

- [x] Implementation
    - #82179
    - #90247
    - #96051
- [x] Final commenting period (FCP)
    - https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/102271#issuecomment-1265324525
- [x] Stabilization PR
    - #102271

<!--
A library team member can kick off the stabilization process, at which point
the rfcbot will ask all the team members to verify they agree with
stabilization. Once enough members agree and there are no concerns, the final
commenting period begins: this issue will be marked as such and will be listed
in the next This Week in Rust newsletter. If no blocking concerns are raised in
that period of 10 days, a stabilzation PR can be opened by anyone.
-->

### Unresolved Questions

 - What should the error type be called?
    - Originally `FromSecsError`.
    - Changed to `FromFloatSecsError` in #90247
    - Changed and finalised as `TryFromFloatSecsError` in #102271
